ygData.subject: RE: RE: Cleric/Bard armor quests
ygData.msgSnippet: In all honesty I too hate seeing a bard, and a level 1 bard mind you in full rubicite wielding dual Ykeshas.  And yes I had that pang of jealousy that we all
ygData.messageBody:
In all honesty I too hate seeing a bard, and a level 1 bard mind you in
full rubicite wielding dual Ykeshas. And yes I had that pang of jealousy
that we all succumb to, but really what are you in the game for? If it
were not for the good friends that I have made I would have left this game
a long time ago. I bet you remember how wild some of your adventures were
and not the 3 hour camp that you did to get a <insert item name here>.

As for making items no drop, it would appease my jealous streak, but it
will also quell my good nature towards my friend. As a present to my
friend who working on a new cleric, I camped 6 hours straight to get her a
set of barbed arms. The camp was horrible, but I did love the thanks I
received from her... If items don't stroke my ego, then let my friends do
it for me. In all truth I really wish some of the other quests were not
no drop so I could give gifts to my friends for their kindness and
understanding.

Treilanin Loreweaver
Bard of Kelethin
Honour Guard, Karana
Happily engaged to the dubbed "Queen of Death".

On Wed, 1 Dec 1999, CYR, Thierry wrote:

> From: "CYR, Thierry" <tcyr@...>
>
> hehe, sounds like me, i hate seeing lev 14 bards in full lambent when my
> bard still doesnt have boots or gloves. but hey, such is life.
>
> as for the TBB, when my group camped for the masks, we got 3 masks that
> night, and 1 burlap bag (yes he spawned). but no TBB
>
> Minkin lev 36 bard
> Razan lev 39 SK
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Mike Roach [SMTP:mike.roach@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, December 01, 1999 12:36 PM
> > To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: Cleric/Bard armor quests
> >
> > From: Mike Roach <mike.roach@...>
> >
> > Talk about tedious...I realize people's mileage may vary in respect to the
> > story I am about to tell, but...
> >
> > At level 35 I finally decided to go for the guise of the deceiver and I
> > hit
> > lower guk for the first time in my career this past weekend. On Sunday I
> > explored and got familiar with the undead area between the zone and the
> > assassin room. On Monday I called out to be put on the mask list at 10am
> > CST. I got into the assassin group by 5pm CST and finally looted the mask
> > at 10:30pm CST.
> >
> > The whole time I was there, a friend from my guild was waiting for the
> > TBB.
> > He had been there for 24 hours straight and did not see one single pop of
> > the ghoul supplier...he finally gave up and logged out due to exhaustion.
> > Now that's an absurdly tedious camp, and I thought I was losing my mind
> > after 5 hours in that blasted assassin/supplier room.
> >
> > For 5 of the hours we camped that room I was the group leader and it was
> > extremely hard because when you put 6 people in that tiny little room for
> > that long they start to get irritated and tempers start to flare...we had
> > more arguments over stupid inane stuff, mostly how to go about doing the
> > looting of the alleged TBB shout the elusive supplier spawn (I still have
> > not seen this supplier to date) that I never ever ever want to be in that
> > room again.
> >
> > But hey, I got my mask and only died twice for my efforts...heh.
> >
> > I'm also a late bloomer bard obtaining my lambent armor and I can identify
> > with Crier in his woes. I just got my first piece, the breastplate, on
> > Saturday night and before that I kept getting tells from strangers, "why
> > don't you have any lambent armor yet?"
> >
> > Because I'm not a twink! I have earned every single item I have the hard
> > way and Faras is not only my first character in EQ, he is my only
> > character
> > and I have over 35 days played too...I am level 35 with one piece of
> > lambent.
> >
> > Hang in there Crier, don't pay attention to those that take the "easy
> > path"
> > because really, they are only hurting themselves. Play the game you want
> > and enjoy it as long as can. Solidarity!
> >
> > Faras Tar'Linedhel
> > Half-Elf Bard
> > E'ci
> > ______________________________
> > "We are what we pretend to be,
> > so we must be careful about
> > what we pretend to be."
> > - Kurt Vonnegut
> >
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
> > > Sent: Wednesday, December 01, 1999 10:57 AM
> > > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [eqbards] RE: Cleric/Bard armor quests
> > >
> > >
> > > From: jhenders@...
> > >
> > > On Wed, Dec 01/99, Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...> wrote:
> > >
> > > >... Having a monster placeholder for a spawn that is 8 hours is
> > > > absoultely ridiculous. I don't envy clerics/shaman.
> > > >
> > >
> > > There is obviously someone at Verant that needs the difference between
> > > challenging and tedious explained to him. Preferable by someone with a
> > > high 1H blunt skill.
> > >
